alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 05 at 5:56PM MST until March 06 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7PM SUNDAY FOR PORTIONS OF THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Windy conditions will return on Sunday, especially along and south of Interstate 40. Though high temperatures will be cooler than Saturday, humidity values will still fall below 15 percent across the lower Rio Grande Valley and portions of the East Central Plains. Critical fire weather conditions are expected to develop during the afternoon hours in these areas. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM MST SUNDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...Portions of the Rio Grande valley in central New Mexico, especially within Socorro county for Sunday afternoon and early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Sustained west winds of 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Falling to 10 to 15 percent in the late afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
